intro: Acetosella lunulata, commonly known as the mooncup, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that resemble tiny cups, typically ranging in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Acetosella lunulata is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
